      protected <T extends Key>
      T      		 KeyStoreBasedManager.getKey(String keyAlias, Class<T> keyType, KeyStore keyStore)
      Utility method that fetches a key from a given KeyStore, and returns it in the following cases: The entry exists The entry is a key entry The key is of (or assignable from) the given Key type
      PrivateKey KeyStoreBasedManager.getPrivateKey(URI keyAlias)
      Retrieves the private key corresponding to a given identifier
      PublicKey KeyStoreBasedManager.getPublicKey(URI keyAlias)
      Retrieves the public key corresponding to a given identifier
      SymmetricKey KeyStoreBasedManager.getSymmetricKey(URI keyAlias)
      Retrieves the symmetric key corresponding to a given name
      protected Certificate KeyStoreBasedManager.getTrustedCertificate(String certificateID)
      Returns a certificate from the trust store ONLY if it is valid; throws an exception otherwise.
      protected void KeyStoreBasedManager.init(KeyStore store, char[] password, Path path, boolean acceptEmpty)
      Reads (and loads if necessary) a given KeyStore.
      void KeyStoreBasedManager.load()
      One-time initialization of the key manager
      protected List<Certificate> KeyStoreBasedManager.verify(List<Certificate> certificateChain)
      Given a (possibly unsorted) certificate chain returns the corresponding ordered certificates list if the chain can be verified against the trust anchors; throws an exception otherwise.
      Certificate KeyStoreBasedManager.verifyCertificateChain(byte[] certificate)
      Verifies the given certificates chain (bytes)
      protected void KeyStoreBasedManager.write(KeyStore store, String keyStoreLocation)
      Writes on a given KeyStore; to use if we modified the key store and want to change its state.
